Heading: Dewey
Note: Dewey Decimal Classification

Heading: LC classification
Note: US Library of Congress classification

Heading: LC subject heading
Note: US Library of Congress subject heading

Heading: NLM classification
Note: US National Library of Medicine medical classification

Heading: MeSH heading
Note: US National Library of Medicine Medical subject heading

Heading: NAL subject heading
Note: US National Agricultural Library subject heading

Heading: AAT
Note: Getty Art and Architecture Thesaurus heading

Heading: UDC
Note: Universal Decimal Classification

Heading: BISAC Subject Heading
Note: BISAC Subject Headings are used in the North American market to categorize books based on topical content. They serve as a guideline for shelving books in physical stores and browsing books in online stores. See https://bisg.org/page/BISACSubjectCodes

Heading: BISAC Regional theme
Note: A geographical qualifier used with a BISAC subject category

Heading: BIC subject category
Note: For all BIC subject codes and qualifiers, see http://www.bic.org.uk/7/BIC-Standard-Subject-Categories/

Heading: BIC reading level and special interest qualifier
DDC-Sachgruppen der Deutschen Nationalbibliografie
Note: Used for German National Bibliography since 2004 (100 subjects). Is different from value 30. See http://www.dnb.de/service/pdf/ddc_wv_aktuell.pdf (in German) or http://www.dnb.de/eng/service/pdf/ddc_wv_aktuell_eng.pdf (English)

Heading: Keywords
Note: For indexing and search purposes, not normally intended for display. Where multiple keywords or keyword phrases are sent, this should be in a single instance of the <SubjectHeadingText> element, and it is recommended that they should be separated by semi-colons (this is consistent with Library of Congress preferred practice)

Heading: BIC children’s book marketing category
Note: See PA/BIC CBMC guidelines at http://www.bic.org.uk/8/Children%27s-Books-Marketing-Classifications/

Heading: BISAC Merchandising Theme
Note: BISAC Merchandising Themes are used in addition to BISAC Subject Headings to denote an audience to which a work may be of particular appeal, a time of year or event for which a work may be especially appropriate, or to further describe fictional works that have been subject-coded by genre

Heading: Proprietary subject scheme
Note: As specified in <SubjectSchemeName>

Heading: Tabla de materias ISBN
Note: Latin America

Heading: Warengruppen-Systematik des deutschen Buchhandels
Note: See http://info.vlb.de/files/wgsneuversion2_0.pdf (in German)

Heading: SWD
Note: Schlagwortnormdatei – Subject Headings Authority File in the German-speaking countries. See http://www.dnb.de/standardisierung/normdateien/swd.htm (in German) and http://www.dnb.de/eng/standardisierung/normdateien/swd.htm (English). DEPRECATED in favor of the GND

Heading: Thèmes Electre
Note: Subject classification used by Electre (France)

Heading: CLIL
Note: France. A four-digit number, see http://www.clil.org/information/documentation.html (in French). The first digit identifies the version of the scheme

Heading: DNB-Sachgruppen
Note: Deutsche Bibliothek subject groups. Used for German National Bibliography until 2003 (65 subjects). Is different from value 18. See http://www.dnb.de/service/pdf/ddc_wv_alt_neu.pdf (in German)

Heading: NUGI
Note: Nederlandse Uniforme Genre-Indeling (former Dutch book trade classification)

Heading: NUR
Note: Nederlandstalige Uniforme Rubrieksindeling (Dutch book trade classification, from 2002, see http://www.boek.nl/nur (in Dutch)

Heading: ECPA Christian Book Category
Note: ECPA Christian Product Category Book Codes, consisting of up to three x 3-letter blocks, for Super Category, Primary Category and Sub-Category. See http://www.ecpa.org/ECPA/cbacategories.xls

Heading: SISO
Note: Schema Indeling Systematische Catalogus Openbare Bibliotheken (Dutch library classification)

Heading: Korean Decimal Classification (KDC)
Note: A modified Dewey Decimal Classification used in the Republic of Korea

Heading: DDC Deutsch 22
Note: German Translation of Dewey Decimal Classification 22. Also known as DDC 22 ger. See http://www.ddc-deutsch.de/produkte/uebersichten/

Heading: Bokgrupper
Note: Norwegian book trade product categories (Bokgrupper) administered by the Norwegian Publishers Association (http://www.forleggerforeningen.no/)

Heading: Varegrupper
Note: Norwegian bookselling subject categories (Bokhandelens varegrupper) administered by the Norwegian Booksellers Association (http://bokhandlerforeningen.no/)

Heading: Læreplaner
Note: Norwegian school curriculum version. Deprecated

Heading: Nippon Decimal Classification
Note: Japanese subject classification scheme

Heading: BSQ
Note: BookSelling Qualifier: Russian book trade classification

Heading: ANELE Materias
Note: Spain: subject coding scheme of the Asociación Nacional de Editores de Libros y Material de Enseñanza

Heading: Utdanningsprogram
Note: Codes for Norwegian ‘utdanningsprogram’ used in secondary education. See: http://www.udir.no/. (Formerly labelled ‘Skolefag’)

Heading: Programområde
Note: Codes for Norwegian ‘programområde’ used in secondary education. See http://www.udir.no/. (Formerly labelled ‘Videregående’ or ‘Programfag’)

Heading: Undervisningsmateriell
Note: Norwegian list of categories for books and other material used in education

Heading: Norsk DDK
Note: Norwegian version of Dewey Decimal Classification

Heading: Varugrupper
Note: Swedish bookselling subject categories

Heading: SAB
Note: Swedish classification scheme

Heading: Läromedelstyp
Note: Swedish bookselling educational subject type

Heading: Förhandsbeskrivning
Note: Swedish publishers preliminary subject classification

Heading: Spanish ISBN UDC subset
Note: Controlled subset of UDC codes used by the Spanish ISBN Agency

Heading: ECI subject categories
Note: Subject categories defined by El Corte Inglés and used widely in the Spanish book trade

Heading: Soggetto CCE
Note: Classificazione commerciale editoriale (Italian book trade subject category based on BIC). CCE documentation available at http://www.ie-online.it/CCE2_2.0.pdf

Heading: Qualificatore geografico CCE
Note: CCE Geographical qualifier

Heading: Qualificatore di lingua CCE
Note: CCE Language qualifier

Heading: Qualificatore di periodo storico CCE
Note: CCE Time Period qualifier

Heading: Qualificatore di livello scolastico CCE
Note: CCE Educational Purpose qualifier

Heading: Qualificatore di età di lettura CCE
Note: CCE Reading Level Qualifier

Heading: VdS Bildungsmedien Fächer
Note: Subject code list of the German association of educational media publishers. See http://www.bildungsmedien.de/service/onixlisten/unterrichtsfach_onix_codelist27_value59_0408.pdf

Heading: Fagkoder
Note: Norwegian primary and secondary school subject categories (fagkoder), see http://www.udir.no/

Heading: JEL classification
Note: Journal of Economic Literature classification scheme

Heading: CSH
Note: National Library of Canada subject heading (English)

Heading: RVM
Note: Répertoire de vedettes-matière Bibliothèque de l’Université Laval) (French)

Heading: YSA
Note: Yleinen suomalainen asiasanasto: Finnish General Thesaurus. See http://onki.fi/fi/browser/ (in Finnish)

Heading: Allärs
Note: Allmän tesaurus på svenska: Swedish translation of the Finnish General Thesaurus. See http://onki.fi/fi/browser/ (in Finnish)

Heading: YKL
Note: Yleisten kirjastojen luokitusjärjestelmä: Finnish Public Libraries Classification System. See http://ykl.kirjastot.fi/ (in Finnish)

Heading: MUSA
Note: Musiikin asiasanasto: Finnish Music Thesaurus. See http://onki.fi/fi/browser/ (in Finnish)

Heading: CILLA
Note: Specialtesaurus för musik: Swedish translation of the Finnish Music Thesaurus. See http://onki.fi/fi/browser/ (in Finnish)

Heading: Kaunokki
Note: Fiktiivisen aineiston asiasanasto: Finnish thesaurus for fiction. See http://kaunokki.kirjastot.fi/ (in Finnish)

Heading: Bella
Note: Specialtesaurus för fiktivt material: Swedish translation of the Finnish thesaurus for fiction. See http://kaunokki.kirjastot.fi/sv-FI/ (in Finnish)

Heading: YSO
Note: Yleinen suomalainen ontologia: Finnish General Upper Ontology. See http://onki.fi/fi/browser/ (In Finnish)

Heading: Paikkatieto ontologia
Note: Finnish Place Ontology. See http://onki.fi/fi/browser/ (in Finnish)

Heading: Suomalainen kirja-alan luokitus
Note: Finnish book trade categorisation

Heading: Sears
Note: Sears List of Subject Headings

Heading: BIC E4L
Note: BIC E4Libraries Category Headings, see http://www.bic.org.uk/51/E4libraries-Subject-Category-Headings/

Heading: CSR
Note: Code Sujet Rayon: subject categories used by bookstores in France

Heading: Suomalainen oppiaineluokitus
Note: Finnish school subject categories

Heading: Japanese book trade C-Code
Note: See http://www.asahi-net.or.jp/~ax2s-kmtn/ref/ccode.html (in Japanese)

Heading: Fiktiivisen aineiston lisäluokitus
Note: Finnish fiction genre classification. See http://ykl.kirjastot.fi/fi-FI/lisaluokat/ (in Finnish)

Heading: Arabized BIC subject category
Note: Arabized version of BIC subject category scheme developed by ElKotob.com

Heading: Arabized LC subject headings
Note: Arabized version of Library of Congress scheme

Heading: Bibliotheca Alexandrina Subject Headings
Note: Classification scheme used by Library of Alexandria

Heading: Postal code
Note: Location defined by postal code. Format is two-letter country code (from List 91), space, postal code. Note some postal codes themselves contain spaces, eg ‘GB N7 9DP’ or ‘US 10125’

Heading: GeoNames ID
Note: ID number for geographical place, as defined at http://www.geonames.org (eg 2825297 is Stuttgart, Germany, see http://www.geonames.org/2825297)

Heading: NewBooks Subject Classification
Note: Used for classification of academic and specialist publication in German-speaking countries. See http://www.newbooks-services.com/de/top/unternehmensportrait/klassifikation-und-mapping.html (German) and http://www.newbooks-services.com/en/top/about-newbooks/classification-mapping.html (English)

Heading: Chinese Library Classification
Note: Subject classification maintained by the Editorial Board of Chinese Library Classification. See http://cct.nlc.gov.cn for access to details of the scheme

Heading: NTCPDSAC Classification
Note: Subject classification for Books, Audiovisual products and E-publications formulated by China National Technical Committee 505

Heading: Season and Event Indicator
Note: German code scheme indicating association with seasons, holidays, events (eg Autumn, Back to School, Easter)

Heading: GND
Note: Gemeinsame Normdatei – Joint Authority File in the German-speaking countries. See http://www.dnb.de/EN/gnd (English). Combines the PND, SWD and GKD into a single authority file, and should be used in preference to the older codes

Heading: BIC UKSLC
Note: UK Standard Library Categories, the successor to BIC’s E4L classification scheme

Heading: Thema subject category
Note: International multilingual subject category scheme – see https://ns.editeur.org/thema

Heading: Thema interest age / special interest qualifier
Ämnesord
Note: Swedish subject categories maintained by Bokrondellen

Heading: Statystyka Książek Papierowych, Mówionych I Elektronicznych
Note: Polish Statistical Book and E-book Classification

Heading: CCSS
Note: Common Core State Standards curriculum alignment, for links to US educational standards. <SubjectCode> uses the full dot notation. See http://www.corestandards.org/developers-and-publishers

Heading: Rameau
Note: French library subject headings

Heading: Nomenclature discipline scolaire
Note: French educational subject classification scolomfr-voc-015. See https://www.reseau-canope.fr/scolomfr/accueil.html

Heading: ISIC
Note: International Standard Industry Classification, a classification of economic activities. Use for books that are about a particular industry or economic activity. <SubjectCode> should be a single letter denoting an ISIC section OR a 2-, 3- or 4-digit number denoting an ISIC division, group or class. See http://unstats.un.org/unsd/cr/registry/isic-4.asp

Heading: LC Children’s Subject Headings
Note: Library of Congress Children’s Subject Headings: LCSHAC supplementary headings for Children’s books

Heading: Ny Läromedel
Note: Swedish bookselling educational subject

Heading: EuroVoc
Note: EuroVoc multilingual thesaurus. <SubjectCode> should be a EuroVoc concept dc:identifier (for example, 2777, ‘refrigerated products’). See http://eurovoc.europa.eu

Heading: BISG Educational Taxonomy
Note: Controlled vocabulary for educational objectives. See https://www.bisg.org/educational-taxonomy

Heading: Keywords (not for display)
Note: For indexing and search purposes, MUST not be displayed. Where multiple keywords or keyword phrases are sent, this should be in a single instance of the <SubjectHeadingText> element, and it is recommended that they should be separated by semi-colons. Use of code B2 should be very rare: use B2 in preference to code 20 only where it is important to show the keyword list is specifically NOT for display to purchasers (eg some keywords for a medical textbook may appear offensive if displayed out of context)

Heading: Nomenclature Diplôme
Note: French higher and vocational educational subject classification scolomfr-voc-29 subject category for degree and diploma study. See https://www.reseau-canope.fr/scolomfr/accueil.html

Heading: Key character names
Note: For fiction and non-fiction, one or more key names, provided – like keywords – for indexing and search purposes. Where multiple character names are sent, this should be in a single instance of <SubjectHeadingText>, and multiple names should be separated by semi-colons. Note <NameAsSubject> should be used for people who are the central subject of the book. Code B4 may be used for names of lesser importance

Heading: Key place names
Note: For fiction and non-fiction, one or more key names, provded – like keywords – for indexing and search purposes. Where multiple place names are sent, this should in a single instance of <SubjectHeadingText>, and multiple names should be separated by semi-colons. For use in ONIX 3.0 only

Heading: FAST
Note: Faceted Application of Subject Terminology, OCLC subject scheme based on but different from LCSH (see code 04). For use in ONIX 3.0 only
